quotes.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs
quotes.history: Said during his famous 2005 Stanford commencement speech.

quotes.text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.history: Einstein's perspective on challenges and growth.

quotes.text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb
quotes.history: Ancient wisdom about taking action.

quotes.text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar
quotes.history: Ziglar was a renowned motivational speaker.

quotes.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill
quotes.history: Spoken during World War II to inspire resilience.

quotes.text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison
quotes.history: Regarding his exhaustive experimentation to invent the light bulb.

quotes.text: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan
quotes.history: From his television series and book 'Cosmos'.

quotes.text: Make something people want.
quotes.author: Paul Graham
quotes.history: The motto of Y Combinator, the world's most famous startup accelerator.

quotes.text: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
quotes.author: Alan Kay
quotes.history: Spoken by the computer scientist in 1971 regarding technological development.

quotes.text: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
quotes.author: Marie Curie
quotes.history: Reflecting her dedication to science despite the dangers of radiation.

quotes.text: Move fast and break things. Unless you are breaking stuff, you are not moving fast enough.
quotes.author: Mark Zuckerberg
quotes.history: Facebook's early internal motto for development.

quotes.text: If I had asked people what they wanted, they would have said faster horses.
quotes.author: Henry Ford
quotes.history: Attributed to Ford regarding the leap from animals to automobiles.

quotes.text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs
quotes.history: From 'The Innovation Secrets of Steve Jobs'.

quotes.text: A ship in port is safe, but that's not what ships are built for.
quotes.author: Grace Hopper
quotes.history: Spoken by the computer science pioneer regarding taking risks.

quotes.text: Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.
quotes.author: Bill Gates
quotes.history: From his book 'Business @ the Speed of Thought'.

quotes.text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke
quotes.history: Clarke's Third Law, formulated in 1962.

quotes.text: I think it is possible for ordinary people to choose to be extraordinary.
quotes.author: Elon Musk
quotes.history: Musk discussing the potential of human agency and risk.

quotes.text: Startups are a cliff you jump off, and you assemble an airplane on the way down.
quotes.author: Reid Hoffman
quotes.history: Description of the entrepreneurial journey by the LinkedIn co-founder.

quotes.text: It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent; it is the one most adaptable to change.
quotes.author: Charles Darwin
quotes.history: Summarizing the central concept of evolutionary biology.

quotes.text: If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?
quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.history: A humorous take on the nature of scientific discovery.

quotes.text: Ideas are easy. Implementation is hard.
quotes.author: Guy Kawasaki
quotes.history: Kawasaki emphasizing execution over mere ideation.

quotes.text: Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan
quotes.history: Reflecting the infinite potential of scientific exploration.

quotes.text: Risk more than others think is safe. Dream more than others think is practical.
quotes.author: Howard Schultz
quotes.history: Philosophy of the Starbucks CEO.

quotes.text: What I cannot create, I do not understand.
quotes.author: Richard Feynman
quotes.history: Found on his blackboard at the time of his death.

quotes.text: The advance of technology is based on making it fit in so that you don't really even notice it, so it's part of everyday life.
quotes.author: Bill Gates
quotes.history: Discussing the ubiquity of successful computing.

quotes.text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci
quotes.history: A principle that has guided art, science, and modern product design.

quotes.text: Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough.
quotes.author: Elon Musk
quotes.history: Regarding the culture at SpaceX and Tesla.

quotes.text: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.history: From an interview in the Saturday Evening Post, 1929.

quotes.text: The biggest risk is not taking any risk.
quotes.author: Mark Zuckerberg
quotes.history: Spoken at Y Combinator's Startup School.

quotes.text: The science of today is the technology of tomorrow.
quotes.author: Edward Teller
quotes.history: Teller was a theoretical physicist known as the father of the hydrogen bomb.

quotes.text: If you are not embarrassed by the first version of your product, you’ve launched too late.
quotes.author: Reid Hoffman
quotes.history: A core tenet of the 'Lean Startup' methodology.

quotes.text: It always seems impossible until it is done.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela
quotes.history: Often applied to social change, but widely used in innovation contexts.

quotes.text: Don’t worry about people stealing your design work. Worry about the day they stop.
quotes.author: Jeffrey Zeldman
quotes.history: A perspective on competition and leadership in design.

quotes.text: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison
quotes.history: Published in Harper's Monthly, 1932.

quotes.text: The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.history: Highlighting creativity as the engine of science.

quotes.text: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.history: Widely attributed to Einstein regarding the joy of discovery.

quotes.text: Work like there is someone working 24 hours a day to take it all away from you.
quotes.author: Mark Cuban
quotes.history: Cuban's advice on work ethic for entrepreneurs.

quotes.text: Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
quotes.author: John Wooden
quotes.history: While a sports quote, it is a staple in management philosophy.

quotes.text: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.history: Advice on observation and understanding complex systems.

quotes.text: Competition is for losers.
quotes.author: Peter Thiel
quotes.history: From his book 'Zero to One', arguing for monopolies through innovation.

quotes.text: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
quotes.author: Grady Booch
quotes.history: Booch is a pioneer in software architecture.

quotes.text: If you want to have good ideas, you must have many ideas.
quotes.author: Linus Pauling
quotes.history: Pauling was a double Nobel Prize winner (Chemistry and Peace).

quotes.text: Don’t find customers for your products, find products for your customers.
quotes.author: Seth Godin
quotes.history: Godin's reversal of traditional marketing logic.

quotes.text: We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.history: A call for paradigm shifts in problem-solving.

quotes.text: Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs
quotes.history: Discussing the functional depth of Apple products.

quotes.text: Above all, don't fear difficult moments. The best comes from them.
quotes.author: Rita Levi-Montalcini
quotes.history: Italian Nobel laureate in Physiology or Medicine.

quotes.text: The universe is under no obligation to make sense to you.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quotes.history: From his book 'Astrophysics for People in a Hurry'.

quotes.text: Timing, perseverance, and ten years of trying will eventually make you look like an overnight success.
quotes.author: Biz Stone
quotes.history: Co-founder of Twitter on the illusion of instant success.

quotes.text: You can't use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou
quotes.history: Though a poet, this is a core mantra for innovators.

quotes.text: Mathematics is the language with which God has written the universe.
quotes.author: Galileo Galilei
quotes.history: Galileo's view on the fundamental nature of physics.

quotes.text: Chase the vision, not the money, the money will end up following you.
quotes.author: Tony Hsieh
quotes.history: The late CEO of Zappos on passion-led business.

quotes.text: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.
quotes.author: Margaret Mead
quotes.history: Mead was a pioneering cultural anthropologist.

quotes.text: Discovery consists of seeing what everybody has seen and thinking what nobody has thought.
quotes.author: Albert Szent-Györgyi
quotes.history: Nobel Prize winner who discovered Vitamin C.

quotes.text: Life is too short to build something nobody wants.
quotes.author: Ash Maurya
quotes.history: Author of 'Running Lean', focusing on product-market fit.

quotes.text: If you don't build your dream, someone else will hire you to help them build theirs.
quotes.author: Dhirubhai Ambani
quotes.history: Founder of Reliance Industries.

quotes.text: Science knows no country, because knowledge belongs to humanity, and is the torch which illuminates the world.
quotes.author: Louis Pasteur
quotes.history: Pasteur emphasizes the universal nature of scientific truth.

quotes.text: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking
quotes.history: Often attributed to Hawking regarding intellectual humility.

quotes.text: The value of an idea lies in the using of it.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison
quotes.history: Emphasizing utility and execution.

quotes.text: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.history: Normalizing failure as a part of the learning process.

quotes.text: The electric light did not come from the continuous improvement of candles.
quotes.author: Oren Harari
quotes.history: A quote on disruptive innovation versus incremental improvement.

quotes.text: High expectations are the key to everything.
quotes.author: Sam Walton
quotes.history: Founder of Walmart on setting standards.

quotes.text: Stay hungry, stay foolish.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs
quotes.history: Quoting the Whole Earth Catalog in his Stanford address.

quotes.text: Equipped with his five senses, man explores the universe around him and calls the adventure Science.
quotes.author: Edwin Hubble
quotes.history: Hubble revolutionized our understanding of the cosmos.

quotes.text: Beware of little expenses. A small leak will sink a great ship.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin
quotes.history: Early American wisdom on financial management.

quotes.text: If I have seen further, it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.
quotes.author: Isaac Newton
quotes.history: Newton acknowledging the work of predecessors like Kepler and Galileo.

quotes.text: Quality is more important than quantity. One home run is much better than two doubles.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs
quotes.history: Jobs on the philosophy of product release.

quotes.text: There are no passengers on Spaceship Earth. We are all crew.
quotes.author: Marshall McLuhan
quotes.history: A call to responsibility for our planet.

quotes.text: Nothing is less productive than to make more efficient what should not be done at all.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker
quotes.history: Management guru on the difference between efficiency and effectiveness.

quotes.text: I never dreamed about success. I worked for it.
quotes.author: Estée Lauder
quotes.history: Lauder on the grit required to build a beauty empire.

quotes.text: The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quotes.history: Defending scientific objectivity on 'Real Time with Bill Maher'.

quotes.text: First, think. Second, believe. Third, dream. And finally, dare.
quotes.author: Walt Disney
quotes.history: The framework of Disney's creative process.

quotes.text: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin
quotes.history: Advocating for education and self-improvement.

quotes.text: The impossible is often the untried.
quotes.author: Jim Goodwin
quotes.history: On the perception of difficulty.

quotes.text: As a technologist, I see how AI and the fourth industrial revolution will impact every aspect of people’s lives.
quotes.author: Fei-Fei Li
quotes.history: Professor of Computer Science at Stanford and AI pioneer.

quotes.text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs
quotes.history: A reminder of mortality as a motivator.

quotes.text: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
quotes.author: Immanuel Kant
quotes.history: Distinguishing between data and application.

quotes.text: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
quotes.author: John D. Rockefeller
quotes.history: On ambition and risk-taking in business.

quotes.text: The most dangerous phrase in the language is, 'We've always done it this way.'
quotes.author: Grace Hopper
quotes.history: Hopper fighting against bureaucracy and stagnation.

quotes.text: The greatest danger for most of us is not that our aim is too high and we miss it, but that it is too low and we reach it.
quotes.author: Michelangelo
quotes.history: Renaissance artist on the importance of ambitious goals.

quotes.text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
quotes.author: Walt Disney
quotes.history: Disney's belief in the power of visualization.

quotes.text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison
quotes.history: On the lack of shortcuts to success.

quotes.text: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison
quotes.history: Describing the resourcefulness required for invention.

quotes.text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov
quotes.history: Asimov was a biochemistry professor and prolific sci-fi author.

quotes.text: You don't learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing, and by falling over.
quotes.author: Richard Branson
quotes.history: Virgin Group founder on experiential learning.

quotes.text: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.history: Einstein valuing creative leaps over linear thought.

quotes.text: The best way to start is to stop talking and begin doing.
quotes.author: Walt Disney
quotes.history: Prioritizing action over planning.

quotes.text: Every great dream begins with a dreamer.
quotes.author: Harriet Tubman
quotes.history: Though a freedom fighter, her words inspire visionary leadership.

quotes.text: It’s hard to do a really good job on anything you don’t think about in the shower.
quotes.author: Paul Graham
quotes.history: Graham on obsession and deep focus.

quotes.text: Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
quotes.history: Dijkstra was a foundational figure in computer science.

quotes.text: One never notices what has been done; one can only see what remains to be done.
quotes.author: Marie Curie
quotes.history: Curie's relentless focus on future discovery.

quotes.text: Optimism is an essential ingredient of innovation. How else can the individual welcome change over security?
quotes.author: Robert Noyce
quotes.history: Noyce was the co-founder of Intel and inventor of the microchip.

quotes.text: If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.
quotes.author: Henry Ford
quotes.history: On the power of mindset and self-belief.

quotes.text: Everything is theoretically impossible, until it is done.
quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein
quotes.history: From the science fiction writer.

quotes.text: The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes.
quotes.author: William James
quotes.history: James was a pioneer in psychology.

quotes.text: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
quotes.author: Austin Freeman
quotes.history: Often quoted in software development and engineering.

quotes.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
quotes.author: Wayne Gretzky
quotes.history: A sports quote universally applied to entrepreneurship.

quotes.text: The secret of change is to focus all of your energy, not on fighting the old, but on building the new.
quotes.author: Socrates
quotes.history: Characterized in the dialogues of Dan Millman.

quotes.text: I would rather have questions that can't be answered than answers that can't be questioned.
quotes.author: Richard Feynman
quotes.history: Feynman on the importance of skepticism and curiosity.

quotes.text: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
quotes.author: Walter Elliot
quotes.history: Defining grit as a series of small efforts.

quotes.text: Data is a precious thing and will last longer than the systems themselves.
quotes.author: Tim Berners-Lee
quotes.history: The inventor of the World Wide Web.

quotes.text: The complexity for the user is inversely proportional to the complexity for the developer.
quotes.author: Unknown
quotes.history: A common maxim in User Experience (UX) design.

quotes.text: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
quotes.author: Linus Torvalds
quotes.history: Torvalds is the creator of Linux.

quotes.text: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare
quotes.history: From Julius Caesar, emphasizing human agency.

quotes.text: I dwell in possibility.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson
quotes.history: A poetic view on the open-ended nature of the future.

quotes.text: The stone age did not end because the world ran out of stones, and the oil age will not end because we run out of oil.
quotes.author: Ahmed Zaki Yamani
quotes.history: Saudi oil minister predicting that innovation drives energy transitions.

poems.text:
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood,
And sorry I could not travel both
And be one traveler, long I stood
And looked down one as far as I could
To where it bent in the undergrowth;

Then took the other, as just as fair,
And having perhaps the better claim,
Because it was grassy and wanted wear;
Though as for that the passing there
Had worn them really about the same,

And both that morning equally lay
In leaves no step had trodden black.
Oh, I kept the first for another day!
Yet knowing how way leads on to way,
I doubted if I should ever come back.

I shall be telling this with a sigh
Somewhere ages and ages hence:
Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—
I took the one less traveled by,
And that has made all the difference.
poems.author: Robert Frost
poems.history: From 'The Road Not Taken' (1916), one of the most famous American poems.

poems.text:
Do not go gentle into that good night,
Old age should burn and rave at close of day;
Rage, rage against the dying of the light.

Though wise men at their end know dark is right,
Because their words had forked no lightning they
Do not go gentle into that good night.

Good men, the last wave by, crying how bright
Their frail deeds might have danced in a green bay,
Rage, rage against the dying of the light.

Wild men who caught and sang the sun in flight,
And learn, too late, they grieved it on its way,
Do not go gentle into that good night.

Grave men, near death, who see with blinding sight
Blind eyes could blaze like meteors and be gay,   
Rage, rage against the dying of the light.

And you, my father, there on the sad height,
Curse, bless, me now with your fierce tears, I pray.
Do not go gentle into that good night.
Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
poems.author: Dylan Thomas
poems.history: Written in 1947, addressed to his dying father.

poems.text:
If you can keep your head when all about you   
    Are losing theirs and blaming it on you,   
If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you,
    But make allowance for their doubting too;   
If you can wait and not be tired by waiting,
    Or being lied about, don’t deal in lies,
Or being hated, don’t give way to hating,
    And yet don’t look too good, nor talk too wise:

If you can dream—and not make dreams your master;   
    If you can think—and not make thoughts your aim;   
If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster
    And treat those two impostors just the same;   
If you can bear to hear the truth you’ve spoken
    Twisted by knaves to make a trap for fools,
Or watch the things you gave your life to, broken,
    And stoop and build ’em up with worn-out tools:

If you can make one heap of all your winnings
    And risk it on one turn of pitch-and-toss,
And lose, and start again at your beginnings
    And never breathe a word about your loss;
If you can force your heart and nerve and sinew
    To serve your turn long after they are gone,   
And so hold on when there is nothing in you
    Except the Will which says to them: ‘Hold on!’

If you can talk with crowds and keep your virtue,   
    Or walk with Kings—nor lose the common touch,
If neither foes nor loving friends can hurt you,
    If all men count with you, but none too much;
If you can fill the unforgiving minute
    With sixty seconds’ worth of distance run,   
Yours is the Earth and everything that’s in it,   
    And—which is more—you’ll be a Man, my son!
poems.author: Rudyard Kipling
poems.history: Opening lines from 'If—' (1895), written as advice to his son.
